question_text: Which of the following explains why UDP is used for VoIP calls?
answer_options: It encrypts voice traffic by default
It guarantees reliable delivery of every packet
It avoids delays caused by retransmissions
It uses error correction to improve quality
correct_answer: It avoids delays caused by retransmissions
explanation: VoIP prefers UDP to maintain low latency, even if some packets are lost. Retransmissions would cause audio lag.
